redcap:Reports.title: Participants who want assistance with vaccination appt

redcap:ProjectDashboards.title: Survey dissemination instructions for F2 (Participant)
redcap:ProjectDashboards.body:
To disseminate this survey in-person
In preparation for dissemination:
  • If you wish to customize the text that displays on the survey completion (after the 'submit' button is clicked):
    • Go to Designer (via the left-hand navigation bar in the Project Home and Design section)
    • Click on Survey Settings for the Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant instrument
    • Scroll down to the Survey Termination Options section
    • Enter your text into the 'Survey Completion Text' box
    • Scroll down and click on the 'save changes' button
  • Bookmark the public survey link on the device that the participant will be completing the survey
    • To access the public survey link, on the tablet:
      • open the browser and log into your institutions' REDCap site
      • click on the project that contains the F2 survey
      • click on Survey Distribution Tools (found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Data Collection section)
      • click the 'open public survey' button. This will open a new tab with the survey. Use browser tools to bookmark the page (consider adding it as a button to the home screen) 
  • Bookmark the Record Status Dashboard page of the project
    • To access the record status dashboard, on the tablet:
      • open the browser and log into your institutions' REDCap site
      • click on the project that contains the survey
      • click on Record Status Dashboard (found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Data Collection section)
      • Use browser tools to bookmark the page (consider adding it as a button to the home screen) 
        • Note: when a person clicks on this bookmark, they will be prompted to log into REDCap
  • If a Co-Participant will be filling out the F3 Co-Participant survey:
    • Bookmark the public survey link of the F3 survey on the tablet
      • open the browser and log into your institutions' REDCap site
      • click on the project that contains the F3 survey
      • click on Survey Distribution Tools (found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Data Collection section)
      • click the 'open public survey' button. This will open a new tab with the survey. Use browser tools to bookmark the page (consider adding it as a button to the home screen) 
    • Make sure that the bookmark is very clear as to which survey it is for (the Participant (F2) or the Co-Participant (F3)
When the participant is with you:
  1. Click on the public survey link (the one that you bookmarked on the tablet for F2)
  2. Enter the participant ID, ADRC number and your initials and answer the additional questions. 
  3. After you click submit, the participant survey is loaded onto the screen. Hand the device to the Participant (or the Co-participant if they are completing it on behalf of the Participant).
  4. Once they complete the survey, they will be directed to return the tablet to the Examiner. 
  5. If a Co-Participant will complete the F3 survey, bring up the bookmarked public survey link for the F3 survey. Enter your Examiner details and then click 'submit'. The F3 survey will load and you can hand the tablet to the Co-Participant.
If the participant needs to return to the survey

If the participant accidentally closes the browser tab or for some other reason starts but does not complete the survey and needs to return to it, you will need to log into REDCap, retrieve their specific survey and give them access to it. To do that:

1. Click on your bookmarked Record Status Dashboard page

2. Find the participant's record in that list.

3. Click on the circle that aligns with the survey.

4. Click on 'Survey Options'

5. Select 'open survey & Log out'. This is important because it prevents the participant from accessing the project and seeing other people's responses. 

6. Hand the tablet to the participant.

If you have questions, please email your REDCap administrator. 

To disseminate this survey via email

1. Log into your institution's REDCap site.

2. Click on the project that contains the survey.

3. Click on 'Add/Edit Records' (via the left-hand navigation bar in the Data Collection section).

4. Click on the circle that aligns with Participant and Site Information.

5. Enter the participant ID, your site name and your initials. 

6. Click on 'save & go to next form'

    -you may have to click on the drop-down arrow on the 'save' button to see the option for 'save & go to next form'

7. Click the 'Survey Options' button and select 'compose survey invitation'

8. Select the address from which you wish to send the survey

9. Enter the participant's email address (or the Co-Participant's email address, if they are completing it on behalf of the Participant)

10. Enter a subject line

11. Add any custom text that you'd like to the message section of the invitation. HOWEVER: do not delete [ survey-link ] or [ survey-url ]. Those are smart variables which will turn into a unique survey link for the participant once you hit send.

12. Click 'send'

If you have questions, please click on the 'Contact REDCap administrator' button found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Help & Information section.

redcap:ProjectDashboards.title: An overview of this project
redcap:ProjectDashboards.body:
Instruments

There are 3 data collection instruments in this project:

1. Participant and Site Information

2. The Participant survey

3. Calculations

The Participant and Site Information instrument is completed by the Examiner. The instrument captures the center name, participant ID and examiner initials as well as details about the completion of the F2 survey. Behind the scenes, REDCap will capture the date/time that the examiner fills out that instrument. 

The Participant survey is filled out by the participant (or the Co-Participant may complete it if the CDR® > 0.5). 

The Calculations instrument pulls data from the participant survey and makes some calculations about survey duration (how long it takes the participant to answer a question or section of questions). 

Records

Each record represents a participant. For your convenience, the participant ID has been added as a custom record label. This means that when viewing records, the participant's ID number will be written next to the record number. When using 'Add/Edit' records, records will display in order of the participant ID. 

Calculation report

There is a built-in report that captures all of the survey duration calculations. You will find that on the left-hand navigation bar in the Reports section. The report is called 'Survey duration'. At the top of the report is a section with some aggregate statistics. The results of those statistics will automatically populate once you disseminate the survey. 

Survey responses report

There is a built-in report that captures all of the participant responses, regardless of if they completed the survey. You will find that on the left-hand navigation bar in the Reports section. It is called 'Survey responses'. You can click on the live filter at the top of the report to limit it to just completed responses. 

Participant Follow-up

To see a list of participants who requested help with making a vaccination appointment, refer to the report named "Participants who want assistance with vaccination appt'. You will find that on the left-hand navigation bar in the Reports section. 

Adding users to the project

Anyone on staff who will need access to the project (to email survey invitations, retrieve partially-completed survey responses, view responses, view calculations, etc) should be added as a user to the project. If you are unfamiliar with how to add users to the project, please contact your REDCap administrator. You can do that by clicking on the blue 'Contact REDCap administrator' button found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Help & Information section.

If you wish to customize the text that displays on the survey completion (after the 'submit' button is clicked):
  • Go to Designer (via the left-hand navigation bar in the Project Home and Design section)
  • Click on Survey Settings for the Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant instrument
  • Scroll down to the Survey Termination Options section
  • Enter your text into the 'Survey Completion Text' box
  • Scroll down and click on the 'save changes' button

MetaDataVersion.Name: Form F2: COVID Impact Survey - Participant v1.3

FormDef.Name: Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant

ItemGroupDef.Name: Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant
Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant
Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant
Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant
Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant
Form F2 Covid Impact Survey - Participant

Question.TranslatedText: Record ID

Instructions for the Center This updated COVID-19 survey is an optional form to be filled out by either the participant (if CDR® Dementia Staging Instrument score = 0 or 0.5) or co-participant/caregiver on behalf of the research participant (if CDR® > 0.5); alternatively, it may be administered by study personnel. Participants may decline to answer questions. If Centers want to obtain information on additional issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but any additional material will not be collected for NACC. This form serves as an update to the original COVID-19 impact Survey released in summer 2020, and reflects on several important updates since that time, including vaccinations, repeat infections, evolving understanding of the long-term impacts of COVID-19 particularly on cognitive function, and broader psychosocial stressors which occurred in the same timeline as the initial and subsequent waves of the pandemic. In addition, it is recognized that many of these aspects of the COVID-19 pandemic may have been experienced differently person to person as well as community to community. The survey is intended to capture a summative experience since the onset of the pandemic, may be used either during initial or follow-up visits, and is potentially adaptable to delivery between those times. Attached to this participant form is a supplemental form for co-participants/caregivers of participants with a CDR® > 0.5. This survey is also optional for Centers. Again, if Centers want to obtain information on additional caregiver issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but this additional material will not be collected for NACC. These surveys may be administered by Centers in conjunction with, or unique and separate from, annual in-person or telephone UDS visits. The timing and option to participate in collection of this important data is entirely up to the individual Centers that are part of the NIA ADRC Program. Each Center should consider administering these surveys to as many participants as possible through either mail, telephone, video, and/or in-person contacts. Centers will need to provide information to participants about local vaccination availability for unvaccinated participants that request information. We have tried to capture important scientific information regarding COVID-19 exposure, medical consequences, and impact on social situations; on cognitive, psychiatric, and behavioral issues; and on caregiver burden and related issues. This information may prove to be extremely useful in our understanding of the impact of such a pandemic on the aging population today and the future.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Instructions for the Center

This updated COVID-19 survey is an optional form to be filled out by either the participant (if CDR® Dementia Staging Instrument score = 0 or 0.5) or co-participant/caregiver on behalf of the research participant (if CDR® > 0.5); alternatively, it may be administered by study personnel. Participants may decline to answer questions. If Centers want to obtain information on additional issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but any additional material will not be collected for NACC.

This form serves as an update to the original COVID-19 impact Survey released in summer 2020, and reflects on several important updates since that time, including vaccinations, repeat infections, evolving understanding of the long-term impacts of COVID-19 particularly on cognitive function, and broader psychosocial stressors which occurred in the same timeline as the initial and subsequent waves of the pandemic. In addition, it is recognized that many of these aspects of the COVID-19 pandemic may have been experienced differently person to person as well as community to community. The survey is intended to capture a summative experience since the onset of the pandemic, may be used either during initial or follow-up visits, and is potentially adaptable to delivery between those times.

Attached to this participant form is a supplemental form for co-participants/caregivers of participants with a CDR® > 0.5. This survey is also optional for Centers. Again, if Centers want to obtain information on additional caregiver issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but this additional material will not be collected for NACC.

These surveys may be administered by Centers in conjunction with, or unique and separate from, annual in-person or telephone UDS visits. The timing and option to participate in collection of this important data is entirely up to the individual Centers that are part of the NIA ADRC Program. Each Center should consider administering these surveys to as many participants as possible through either mail, telephone, video, and/or in-person contacts. Centers will need to provide information to participants about local vaccination availability for unvaccinated participants that request information.

We have tried to capture important scientific information regarding COVID-19 exposure, medical consequences, and impact on social situations; on cognitive, psychiatric, and behavioral issues; and on caregiver burden and related issues. This information may prove to be extremely useful in our understanding of the impact of such a pandemic on the aging population today and the future.

Question.TranslatedText: Complete?

The following COVID-19 survey is an optional form we would like you to fill out (or, alternatively, the survey may be administered to you by research study staff). We are asking these questions because COVID-19 has presented multiple challenges for us all, and we would like to learn about your experience. We also would like to learn how COVID-19 affects memory and health. As a research participant, you may decline to answer any of these questions, and it is alright to do so, but please answer as many of the questions as you feel comfortable with. Your research center may also have additional questions regarding COVID-19.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: The following COVID-19 survey is an optional form we would like you to fill out (or, alternatively, the survey may be administered to you by research study staff). We are asking these questions because COVID-19 has presented multiple challenges for us all, and we would like to learn about your experience. We also would like to learn how COVID-19 affects memory and health. As a research participant, you may decline to answer any of these questions, and it is alright to do so, but please answer as many of the questions as you feel comfortable with. Your research center may also have additional questions regarding COVID-19.

Question.TranslatedText: Survey start time
During the COVID-19 pandemic, have you tested positive for COVID-19 and/or were diagnosed with COVID-19 by a healthcare provider)?

During the COVID-19 pandemic, have you experienced new or worsening symptoms (see below) that led you to think you had COVID-19 (novel coronavirus) such as fever, cough, difficulty breathing, persistent pain or pressure in the chest, chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat, new loss of taste or smell, new confusion or inability to arouse, or bluish lips or face?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: During the COVID-19 pandemic, have you experienced new or worsening symptoms (see below) that led you to think you had COVID-19 (novel coronavirus) such as fever, cough, difficulty breathing, persistent pain or pressure in the chest, chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat, new loss of taste or smell, new confusion or inability to arouse, or bluish lips or face?

Question 10 timestamp
Do you need help in setting up a COVID vaccination for yourself?
On a scale of 1-5, how worried are you that you will get COVID-19 (or, if previously infected, worried that you will get it again)?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On a scale of 1-5, how worried are you that you will get COVID-19 (or, if previously infected, worried that you will get it again)?

Question.TranslatedText: On a scale of 1-5, how disruptive has the COVID-19 pandemic been to your everyday life?
On a scale of 1-6 (with 1 being "I can shake off stress" and 6 being "Stress eats away at me") how would you rate your ability to handle stress?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On a scale of 1-6 (with 1 being "I can shake off stress" and 6 being "Stress eats away at me") how would you rate your ability to handle stress?

Question.TranslatedText: In the past year, on a scale of 1-6 with 1 being "no stress" and 6 being "extreme stress" how would you rate the amount of stress in your life (at home and at work)?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: In the past year, on a scale of 1-6 with 1 being "no stress" and 6 being "extreme stress" how would you rate the amount of stress in your life (at home and at work)?

Decode.TranslatedText: Mount Sinai School of Medicine ADRC
Oregon Health and Science University, ADRC
Yes, based on a positive test for acute infection
Yes, presumed COVID-19 diagnosis by healthcare provider but not tested
No, not tested (wanted to but unable)
No, not tested (did not want to get tested)
Yes, I was tested more than once
Not yet recovered (symptoms persist to the present)
Not yet recovered (symptoms persist to the present)
Not yet recovered (symptoms persist to the present)
Not yet recovered (symptoms persist to the present)
Phone consultation or virtual care visit
In-person physician or urgent care visit
Hospitalized but not the intensive care unit (ICU)
Hospitalized, including a stay in the ICU and/or ventilator support (breathing tube in your throat)
Did not want to get vaccinated
One: Partial vaccination (one dose of two-dose series)
One: One-dose series, e.g., Janssen (Johnson & Johnson) without booster
Two: One-dose series with one booster
Three: Two-dose series with one booster
Three +: One-dose series with more than one booster
Four +: Two-dose series with more than one booster
